gov.niarl.his.privacyca

Class TpmUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.niarl.his.privacyca.TpmUtils

  • public class TpmUtils
extends Object

    The utils class contains functions that fall into two categories: those that provide utility to other classes in this package; and those that perform some cross-class functionality that is specific to this package.

    This package was created for performing as a Privacy Certification Authority (Privacy CA), as specified by the Trusted Computing Group. The function ProcessIdentityRequest encompasses the role of a Privacy CA by taking an identity request, processing it with a CA signing key, and producing the specified data blobs containing a certificate.

    The function makeEkCert works similarly to create a certificate for a TPM's Endorsement Key (EK certificate). This is not a defined role of a Privacy CA, however the process of creating an EK certificate is not covered in any TCG documentation, and the process of creating such a certificate is very similar to that used for processing an identity request.

    The creation of an identity request is generally performed by the TSS function Tspi_TPM_CollateIdentityRequest. There are times, however, when it may be necessary to fabricate an identity request from its basic components. The function createIdentityRequest can be used to do just that. It is flexible enough to create a request in the format of any of the popular flavors of TSS.

    Some of the functions provided in this class require the BouncyCastle security provider library, version 141 (for Java 1.5, this is the library named bcprov-jdk15-141.jar).

    Author:
    schawki

      • getUINT32

        public static int getUINT32(ByteArrayInputStream source)
                     throws TpmUtils.TpmUnsignedConversionException,
                            TpmUtils.TpmBytestreamResouceException
        Extracts four bytes in the form of a UINT32 from a ByteArrayInputStream and converts it to an integer. The byte stream will be reduced by four bytes. Note: the Java integer is signed, but the UINT32 is not (by definition). The integer was chosen to hold the value of a UINT32 because both are four bytes in size, even though the Java integer has a positive max value half that of the UINT32. As this conversion function converts from a UINT32, there sill never be a negative value extracted. The possibility exists that a UINT32 with a value greater than the integer MAX_VALUE will attempt to be extracted using this function. In that case, an exception will be thrown. This situation is not likely to occur, as UINT32 values are used for two purposes by the TCG: defined attributes/flags, and size values. When a UINT32 is used as an attribute or flag, the value is not as important as is the bit order. (Also, there are no attributes of flags in which the most significant bit is set.) As a size, the value is usually in numbers of bytes, and occasionally in number of bits. In either case, there is not likely to be a size, even in bits, that comes near to approaching the max value of integer.
        Parameters:
        source - The ByteArrayInputStream from which the UINT32 is to be extracted.
        Returns:
        An integer with the value of the UINT32.
        Throws:
        TpmUtils.TpmUnsignedConversionException - The UINT32 being extracted is too large to be stored in an integer.
        TpmUtils.TpmBytestreamResouceException - A UINT32 is four bytes in length, this exception is throws in there are not at least 4 bytes available to extract.

      • getUINT16

        public static short getUINT16(ByteArrayInputStream source)
                       throws TpmUtils.TpmUnsignedConversionException,
                              TpmUtils.TpmBytestreamResouceException
        Extracts a UINT16 from a bytestream and stores is as a short. See getUINT32 for issues that apply to this function.
        Parameters:
        source - The ByteArrayInputStream from which the UINT16 will be extracted.
        Returns:
        A short with the value of the UINT16 extracted.
        Throws:
        TpmUtils.TpmUnsignedConversionException - Thrown if the UINT16 is too large to be stored as a short.
        TpmUtils.TpmBytestreamResouceException - Thrown if there are not at least two bytes available in the bytestream to extract.

      • getBytes

        public static byte[] getBytes(ByteArrayInputStream source,
              int size)
                       throws TpmUtils.TpmBytestreamResouceException
        Extracts a specified number of bytes from a ByteArrayInputStream and places them into a byte array.
        Parameters:
        source - The ByteArrayInputStream from which to extract the requested number of bytes.
        size - The number of bytes to extract.
        Returns:
        A byte array of size size.
        Throws:
        TpmUtils.TpmBytestreamResouceException - Thrown if the number of bytes requested exceeds the number of available bytes in the bytestream.

      • makeCert

        public static X509Certificate makeCert(TpmIdentityProof idProof,
                       RSAPrivateKey privKey,
                       X509Certificate caCert,
                       int validityDays,
                       int level)
                                throws InvalidKeySpecException,
                                       NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                       CertificateEncodingException,
                                       NoSuchProviderException,
                                       SignatureException,
                                       InvalidKeyException
        Creates a new X509 V3 certificate for use as an Attestation Identity Key (AIK) using the BouncyCastle provider. The certificate is designed in the direction of the Trusted Computing Group's specification of certificates for the Trusted Platform Module, although in its current form this function does not meet the standard. To that extent, the Subject Name field is left blank, and the V3 Subject Alternative Name field is marked critical and populated with the ID Label specified in the supplied TPM_Identity_Proof structure.
        Parameters:
        idProof - The TPM_Identity_Proof structure, used for the identity label field.
        privKey - The Privacy CA's private key for signing the certificate.
        caCert - The Privacy CA's public key certificate.
        validityDays - The number of days until the created certificate expires, from the time this function is run.
        level - Currently not used.
        Returns:
        An AIK certificate.
        Throws:
        InvalidKeySpecException - Passed on from the BouncyCastle certificate generator.
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - Passed on from the BouncyCastle certificate generator.
        CertificateEncodingException - Passed on from the BouncyCastle certificate generator.
        NoSuchProviderException - Thrown if the BouncyCastle provider cannot be found.
        SignatureException - Passed on from the BouncyCastle certificate generator.
        InvalidKeyException - Passed on from the BouncyCastle certificate generator.

      • createCaP12

        public static void createCaP12(int keySize,
               String caName,
               String newP12Pass,
               String p12FileName,
               int validityDays)
                        throws NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                               InvalidKeyException,
                               IllegalStateException,
                               SignatureException,
                               KeyStoreException,
                               CertificateException,
                               IOException
        Creates a key pair and associated certificate for a certificate authority. An RSA key pair of specified size is stored with the self-signed certificate in an encrypted PKCS 12 key store file. The format of the certificate and PKCS 12 file are a replica of what is created by OpenSSL.
        Parameters:
        keySize - The size (in bits) of the RSA key to create
        caName - The subject name for the new Certificate Authority (do not include "CN=")
        newP12Pass - The password for encrypting the PKCS 12 file
        p12FileName - The name for the PKCS 12 key store file (should end with .p12)
        validityDays - The number of days the certificate should be valid before expiring
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException
        InvalidKeyException
        IllegalStateException
        SignatureException
        KeyStoreException
        CertificateException
        IOException

      • createClientP12

        public static void createClientP12(int keySize,
                   String subjectName,
                   String newP12Pass,
                   String p12FileName,
                   int validityDays,
                   X509Certificate caCert,
                   RSAPrivateKey caPrivKey)
                            throws NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                   InvalidKeyException,
                                   IllegalStateException,
                                   SignatureException,
                                   KeyStoreException,
                                   CertificateException,
                                   IOException
        This function creates a p12 file for a client, creating a new RSA key pair of specified size. A certificate generated, signed by a the CA using the specified private key and CA certificate file. Both the client and CA certificates are stored as a chain in the p12 file. The client certificate's serial number is a system time in miliseconds.
        Parameters:
        keySize - Size of the key to generate
        subjectName - Subject name for the client certificate
        newP12Pass - Password to use for encrypting the p12 file
        p12FileName - name for the generated file
        validityDays - number of days the client certificate should be valid
        caCert - The CA's certificate
        caPrivKey - The CA's private key, for signing the client certificate
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException
        InvalidKeyException
        IllegalStateException
        SignatureException
        KeyStoreException
        CertificateException
        IOException

      • makeEkCert

        public static X509Certificate makeEkCert(byte[] pubEkMod,
                         RSAPrivateKey privKey,
                         X509Certificate caCert,
                         int validityDays)
                                  throws NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                         InvalidKeySpecException,
                                         SignatureException,
                                         NoSuchProviderException,
                                         InvalidKeyException,
                                         CertificateEncodingException
        Creates an Endorsement Key (EK) Certificate. This certificate is not fully meet Trusted Computing Group specifications. Aside from the key and label source, the certificate is basically identical to the AIK certificate made by the makeCert function. The label used is "TPM EK Credential". Ideally, an EK certificate should only be created once per TPM and stored in the TPM's NVRAM, but this function can be used to provide the certificate while a method is being researched for the permanent storage of the EK certificate in NVRAM.
        Parameters:
        pubEkMod - The modulus of the public Endorsement Key (EK) in the form of a byte array.
        privKey - The Privacy CA's private signing key.
        caCert - The Privacy CA's public key certificate.
        validityDays - The number of days until expiration, from the time this function is run.
        Returns:
        An EK certificate for the specified TPM's EK.
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - Passed on from the BouncyCastle certificate generator.
        InvalidKeySpecException - Passed on from the BouncyCastle certificate generator.
        SignatureException - Passed on from the BouncyCastle certificate generator.
        NoSuchProviderException - Thrown if the BouncyCastle provider cannot be found.
        InvalidKeyException - Passed on from the BouncyCastle certificate generator.
        CertificateEncodingException - Passed on from the BouncyCastle certificate generator.

        InvalidKeySpecException - Thrown if the key material is bad.

      • verifyTPM

        public static boolean verifyTPM(X509Certificate ekCred)
        This function is not yet implemented. The intended purpose is to check the validity of an EK certificate supplied in an identity request. A valid certificate is one signed by a trusted entity. Another potential version of validity is the EK being present in a database of known TPMs.
        Parameters:
        ekCred - The EK certificate from the identity proof.
        Returns:
        True, if EK certificate passes verification.

      • ProcessIdentityRequest

        public static idResponse ProcessIdentityRequest(byte[] idRequestBlob,
                                RSAPrivateKey caPrivKey,
                                X509Certificate caPubCert,
                                int validityDays)
                                         throws PrivacyCaException,
                                                TpmUtils.TpmUnsignedConversionException,
                                                BadPaddingException,
                                                IllegalBlockSizeException,
                                                InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
                                                NoSuchPaddingException,
                                                NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                                InvalidKeyException,
                                                CertificateEncodingException,
                                                IOException,
                                                InvalidKeySpecException,
                                                SignatureException,
                                                NoSuchProviderException,
                                                CertificateException,
                                                CertificateException,
                                                TpmUtils.TpmBytestreamResouceException
        Take an incoming identity request, unpack the contents, create an identity certificate, and return it in the properly formated form.
        Parameters:
        idRequestBlob - The TPM_Identity_Request, as a byte array, as received from the output of the Tspi_TPM_CollateIdentityRequest TSS function.
        caPrivKey - The Privacy CA's private signing key.
        caPubCert - The Privacy CA's public key certificate.
        validityDays - The number of validity days, after which the certificate will expire.
        Returns:
        An idResponse, containing both TPM_ASYM_CA_CONTENTS and TPM_SYM_CA_ATTESTATION structures, suitable as input for the Tspi_TPM_ActivateIdentity function.
        Throws:
        PrivacyCaException - Thrown if an error occurs when processing the request.
        TpmUtils.TpmUnsignedConversionException - Passed from called functions, this most likely reflects a poorly constructed Identity Request or its base Identity Proof.
        BadPaddingException - Passed if an encryption/decryption error occurs.
        IllegalBlockSizeException - Passed if an encryption/decryption error occurs.
        InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - Passed if an encryption/decryption error occurs.
        NoSuchPaddingException - Passed if an encryption/decryption error occurs.
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - Passed if an encryption/decryption error occurs.
        InvalidKeyException - Passed if an encryption/decryption error occurs.
        CertificateEncodingException - Passed if an certificate creation error occurs.
        IOException - Passed if an certificate creation error occurs.
        InvalidKeySpecException - Passed if an certificate creation error occurs.
        SignatureException - Passed if an certificate creation error occurs.
        NoSuchProviderException - Passed if an certificate creation error occurs.
        CertificateException - Passed if an certificate creation error occurs.
        CertificateException - Passed if an certificate creation error occurs.
        TpmUtils.TpmBytestreamResouceException - Passed from called functions, this most likely reflects a poorly constructed Identity Request or its base Identity Proof.

      • PartiallyProcessIdentityRequest

        public static X509Certificate PartiallyProcessIdentityRequest(byte[] idRequestBlob,
                                              RSAPrivateKey caPrivKey,
                                              X509Certificate caPubCert,
                                              int validityDays)
                                                       throws PrivacyCaException,
                                                              TpmUtils.TpmUnsignedConversionException,
                                                              BadPaddingException,
                                                              IllegalBlockSizeException,
                                                              InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
                                                              NoSuchPaddingException,
                                                              NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                                              InvalidKeyException,
                                                              CertificateEncodingException,
                                                              IOException,
                                                              InvalidKeySpecException,
                                                              SignatureException,
                                                              NoSuchProviderException,
                                                              CertificateException,
                                                              CertificateException,
                                                              TpmUtils.TpmBytestreamResouceException
        Used by the Privacy CA (version 1) to process Identity Requests that do not contain an EC. The EC is not validated, and the AIC is returned in plaintext. The client can then get the AIC without using ActivateIdentity. This is here because the Windows (NTRU) TSS client is broken, and cannot include the EC in an Identity Request, and also cannot perform an ActivateIdentity properly.
        Parameters:
        idRequestBlob - The incomming Identity Request with no EC
        caPrivKey - The Privacy CA's private key
        caPubCert - The Privacy CA's certificate
        validityDays - The number of days before AIC expiration
        Returns:
        the AIC in the form of an X509Certificate
        Throws:
        PrivacyCaException
        TpmUtils.TpmUnsignedConversionException
        BadPaddingException
        IllegalBlockSizeException
        InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        NoSuchPaddingException
        NoSuchAlgorithmException
        InvalidKeyException
        CertificateEncodingException
        IOException
        InvalidKeySpecException
        SignatureException
        NoSuchProviderException
        CertificateException
        CertificateException
        TpmUtils.TpmBytestreamResouceException

      • createIdentityRequest

        public static TpmIdentityRequest createIdentityRequest(String idLabel,
                                       RSAPublicKey caPubKey,
                                       boolean IV,
                                       boolean symKey,
                                       boolean oaep)
                                                throws TpmUtils.TpmUnsignedConversionException,
                                                       NoSuchPaddingException,
                                                       NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                                       InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
                                                       InvalidKeyException,
                                                       BadPaddingException,
                                                       IllegalBlockSizeException,
                                                       IOException
        Generate a new identity request. User supplied data for a new request is the identity label and the Privacy CA's public key. This function relies upon a method to obtain the public key of a newly-created identity key (to be certified by the Privacy CA), an identity binding signed by the TPM, and any certificates available from the TPM's non-volatile storage (Endorsement, Platform, and/or Conformance certificates). Note: the endorsement certificate must be present to have a complete request! The functionality to get this TPM-supplied data is currently not available.
        Parameters:
        idLabel - A string, to be submitted in ASCII, to be used as the subject alternative name for the identity certificate
        caPubKey - The public key of the Privacy CA
        IV - A boolean flag to specify the placement of the symmetric encryption initialization vector (true indicates that IV should be placed at the beginning of symmetrically encrypted blob instead of the symmetric key parameters)
        symKey - A boolean flag to specify the symmetric key encryption scheme flag (true indicates the encryption scheme should be specified as "TSS_ES_NONE")
        oaep - A boolean flag to indicate if the asymmetric OAEP padding will use the string specified in the TSS 1.1b "Main" document (true indicates that the string should be left blank)
        Returns:
        Throws:
        TpmUtils.TpmUnsignedConversionException
        NoSuchPaddingException
        NoSuchAlgorithmException
        InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        InvalidKeyException
        BadPaddingException
        IllegalBlockSizeException
        IOException

      • createRandomBytes

                                throws IOException
        Fills a 16 byte array with random data, using nanoTime.

        A byte array of length 16 containing new random data.
        Throws:

      • hexStringToByteArray

        public static byte[] hexStringToByteArray(String s)
        Given a string of hexadecimal characters, convert to a byte array. No checks are performed to ensure that the string is all valid hexidecimal characters (0-9, a-f, A-F) or that there is an even number of characters.
        Parameters:
        s - The hexadecimal string
        Returns:
        A byte array

      • byteArrayToHexString

        public static String byteArrayToHexString(byte[] b)
        Convert a byte array to a hexidecimal character string. The string will have no delimeter between hexidecimal duples, and has no line breaks.
        Parameters:
        b - Byte array to convert
        Returns:
        A string of hexidecimal characters

      • byteArrayToCppHexString

        public static String byteArrayToCppHexString(byte[] b)
        Convert a byte array to a hexidecimal character string, in a format that can be placed as a parameter in C++. The hexidecimal byte duples are each prefixed with "0x" and delimted with a comma and space (", "). Example: "0x0a, 0xbc, "
        Parameters:
        b - Byte array to convert
        Returns:
        String in the format described above

      • TCGAsymEncrypt

        public static byte[] TCGAsymEncrypt(byte[] payload,
                    RSAPublicKey pubKey,
                    String OAEPstring)
                             throws NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                    NoSuchPaddingException,
                                    InvalidKeyException,
                                    InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
                                    IllegalBlockSizeException,
                                    BadPaddingException
        Perform an asymmetric encryption of a byte array in the way specified by the TCG for all TPM-related operations, using the given OAEP string (in case it is not the TCG-specified "TCPA")
        Parameters:
        payload - Byte array to encrypt
        pubKey - RSA public key to use for encryption
        OAEPstring - The OAEP string to use for padding
        Returns:

        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException
        NoSuchPaddingException
        InvalidKeyException
        InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        IllegalBlockSizeException
        BadPaddingException

      • TCGSymEncrypt

        public static byte[] TCGSymEncrypt(byte[] payload,
                   byte[] key,
                   byte[] iv)
                            throws NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                   NoSuchPaddingException,
                                   InvalidKeyException,
                                   InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
                                   IllegalBlockSizeException,
                                   BadPaddingException
        Perform a symmetric encryption of a byte array in the way specified by the TCG for all TPM-related symmetric encryption activities. The given key and IV are used.
        Parameters:
        payload - Byte array to encrypt
        key - Symmetric (AES) key to use. Exception will be thrown if key is an invalid length.
        iv - Initialization Vector to use. Exception will be thrown if IV is an invalid length.
        Returns:
        Encrypted byte blob.
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException
        NoSuchPaddingException
        InvalidKeyException
        InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        IllegalBlockSizeException
        BadPaddingException

      • TCGAsymDecrypt

        public static byte[] TCGAsymDecrypt(byte[] ciphertext,
                    RSAPrivateKey privKey,
                    String OAEPstring)
                             throws NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                    NoSuchPaddingException,
                                    InvalidKeyException,
                                    InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
                                    IllegalBlockSizeException,
                                    BadPaddingException
        Decrypt an TCG-style asymmetrically encrypted byte blob, given the correct RSA private key and OAEP string. If properly encrypted, the OAEP string should be "TCPA" (less the quotes).
        Parameters:
        ciphertext - Asymmetrically encrypted byte array
        privKey - The RSA private key to be used to decrypt the ciphertext
        OAEPstring - The OAEP string that was used for padding (should be "TCPA")
        Returns:
        The decrypted byte array
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException
        NoSuchPaddingException
        InvalidKeyException
        InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        IllegalBlockSizeException
        BadPaddingException

      • TCGSymDecrypt

        public static byte[] TCGSymDecrypt(byte[] ciphertext,
                   byte[] key,
                   byte[] iv)
                            throws NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                   NoSuchPaddingException,
                                   InvalidKeyException,
                                   InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
                                   IllegalBlockSizeException,
                                   BadPaddingException
        Decrypt an AES/CBC/PKCS5Paddded symmetrically encrypted blob, using the given key and IV.

        key - The key used to perform the decryption
        iv - The Initialization Vector used
        Returns:
        The decrypted byte array
        Throws:

        InvalidKeyException
        InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        IllegalBlockSizeException
        BadPaddingException

      • HMAC

        public static byte[] HMAC(byte[] authBlob,
          byte[] xH1concat)
                   throws Exception
        Generate a Hashed Message Authentication Code for TCS function authentication using the given auth blob and concatenation of all *H1 (1H1, 2H1, etc) values for the function.
        Parameters:
        authBlob - 20 byte auth code for the object in question
        xH1concat - A concatenation of all of the authenticated *H1 parameters for the function, e.g. 1H1, 2H1, 3H1, etc.
        Returns:
        The HMAC blob suitable to be used for passing as a TCS parameter
        Throws:
        Exception
